isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 14. Glow Plug System

svcprocinfo.para: PurposeTo determine if the glow plug system is operating correctly to start the engine

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

figure.caption: Amp Clamp around feed wire loom for left side glow plugs

step1.para: Install Amp Clamp around the feed wire loom for glow plugs in the left side.
Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not start the engine.)
Select D_OutputStateTest.ssn in the Open Session File window, select Open to detect possible DTCs.

figure.caption: Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do the KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard Test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard Test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From Key-On Engine-Off Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test and click run to start the test.

note.para: The Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test will command the glow plugs on for 120 seconds. Both sides can be tested during this time. The Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test is limited to two requests per key cycle.

step1.para: After 40 seconds, measure amperage.
Record the amperage reading for the left side on Diagnostic form.

figure.caption: Amp Clamp around feed wire loom for right side glow plugs

step1.para: Install Amp Clamp around the feed wire loom for glow plugs in the right side.
Record the amperage reading for the right side on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If amperage is to specification and DTCs were not set, the glow plug system is working correctly and is not the starting problem.

If amperage is to specification and DTC 375 was set, check for corroded wires and loose connections on relay terminals. If wires are not corroded and connections are tight, see " GPC (Glow Plug Control) Circuit
" in the " Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics
" section of this manual. DTC 375 can be set if there is an open in the GPDcircuit.
If amperage is not to specification and DTCs were not set, do " Test 14.2. Glow Plug Harness to Ground ."

note.para: DTC 251 can only be set during the KOEO Standard Test.

item.para:
If amperage is 0 and DTC 251 was set, see " GPC (Glow Plug Control) Circuit" in the " Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics
" section of this manual. DTC 251 can be set if there is an open or short in the GPC circuit, relay ground circuit or a failed glow plug relay.
If DTC 375 was set, DTC 251 was not set, and amperage is 0 for right and left glow plugs, see relay operation.

step1.para: When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.
Select the feed wiring loom for the glow plug side that failed.
Disconnect glow plug 3-pin connector.
Use DMM to measure resistance between glow plug 3-pin harness and alternator ground.

note.para: This checks glow plug harness and glow plugs.

step1.para: Record result on Diagnostics form.

item.para: If any reading is not within 0.1 - 6 ohms, do test " 14.3 Glow Plug to ground ."
If all readings are within 0.1 - 6 ohms, do test " 14.4 Engine Harness 3-pin to Relay ."

step1.para: Disconnect glow plug harness from suspect glow plug.
Connect glow plug test lead.
Use DMM to measure glow plug resistance to ground.
Record result for each suspect glow plug on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If resistance is greater than 5 ohms, replace glow plug.
If resistance is less than 5 ohms, replace glow plug harness.

figure.caption: Resistance between glow plug relay and glow plug

step1.para: Use DMM to measure resistance of wire between the glow plug relay and all three circuits in the 3-pin connector.

note.para: Engines could be wired differently, having wiring harness connectors secured to different relay terminals. Trace wiring harness from 3-pin connector to the glow plug relay (the shortest) to be sure that the correct relay terminal is being tested.

step1.para: Record results on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If resistance is greater than 5 ohms, check for loose connections and terminals. Repair or replace wiring between glow plug relay and 3-pin connector.

If resistance is less than 5 ohms and DTC 251 was not set, check for corroded wires and loose connections on relay terminals. If wires are not corroded and connections are tight and do " Test 14.5. Relay Operation ."

step1.para: Connect DMM positive lead to battery supply terminal (battery to glow plug relay).

note.para: Engines could be wired differently, having wiring harness connectors secured to different relay terminals. Trace wiring harness from battery to the glow plug relay (the shortest) to be sure that the correct relay terminal is being tested.

step1.para: Connect DMM negative lead to alternator ground.
Use DMM to measure voltage.
Record result on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If voltage at relay supply terminal is B+, continue with step 5
If voltage at relay supply terminal is less than B+, repair or replace wire from battery to glow plug relay.

step1.para: Connect DMM positive lead to glow plug relay output terminal.

note.para: Engines could be wired differently, having wiring harness connectors secured to different relay terminals. Trace wiring harness from 3-pin connector to the glow plug relay (the shortest) to be sure that the correct relay terminal is being tested.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not start engine.)
Select D_OutputStateTest.ssn in the Open Session File window, select Open to detect possible DTCs.

figure.caption: Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do the KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard Test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard Test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater, then select Run to start the test.

note.para: The Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test will command the glow plugs on for 120 seconds. The Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test is limited to two requests per key cycle.

step1.para: Use DMM to measure voltage.
Record result on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If voltage was not detected and DTC 251 was not set, check for corroded wires and loose connections on relay terminals. If terminals are clean and connections were tight, replace the relay.

If voltage was not detected and DTC 251 was set, see " GPC (Glow Plug Control) Circuit
" in the " Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics
" section of this manual. DTC 251 can be set if there is an open or short in the GPC circuit, open relay ground circuit or a failed glow plug relay coil.

step1.para: When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.
